contentDescription: HTML5 is the latest evolution of the standard that defines HTML. This course covers new features of HTML5, such as semantic elements, multimedia support, and the canvas element. Learn how to create modern, accessible web pages using the latest HTML standards.

ECMAScript 6 (ES6) introduced significant changes to JavaScript, including new syntax, features, and built-in functions. This course will walk you through the new features such as arrow functions, classes, modules, and destructuring.

React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. This course will introduce you to the core concepts of React, including components, JSX, state, and props. By the end of this course, you'll have a solid foundation to start building your own React applications.

Node.js is a powerful JavaScript runtime that allows you to build server-side applications. In this course, you will learn the fundamentals of Node.js, including setting up a server, handling requests, and working with file systems.
MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents. This course provides an overview of MongoDB, including installation, CRUD operations, and data modeling.
This course explores the differences between SQL and NoSQL databases. You'll learn when to use each type of database and the advantages and disadvantages of both.
CSS Grid Layout is a two-dimensional layout system for the web. This course will teach you how to create complex layouts using CSS Grid properties and techniques.
Git is a version control system that helps developers manage changes to their code. In this course, you'll learn the basics of Git, including repositories, commits, branches, and merges.
In this course, you'll learn the principles of RESTful API design. You'll understand how to design and build APIs that follow REST principles, including proper use of HTTP methods and status codes.

This course provides an introduction to web application security. You'll learn about common vulnerabilities, such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS), and how to protect your applications from these threats.

Responsive web design is essential for creating websites that work on all devices. This course will teach you techniques for making your websites responsive using CSS media queries and flexible grids.
This course is designed for those new to programming. You'll learn the basics of JavaScript, including variables, loops, and functions, as well as how to manipulate the DOM.

React Hooks revolutionized the way developers write components in React. This course delves deep into the use of hooks such as useState, useEffect, and custom hooks to manage state and side effects in functional components.
Express is one of the most popular web frameworks for Node.js. In this course, you'll learn how to build robust APIs using Express, covering routing, middleware, and RESTful endpoints.

In this course, you'll learn advanced techniques for modeling data in MongoDB to handle complex use cases. Topics include handling relationships between documents, embedding vs. referencing, and optimizing queries for large datasets.
Normalization is key to creating efficient and organized databases. In this course, you’ll learn how to normalize databases to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity.
Sass is a powerful CSS preprocessor that enables you to write maintainable and reusable CSS. This course covers variables, nesting, and mixins to streamline your CSS workflow.

GitHub is a platform that allows developers to collaborate on projects using Git. In this course, you’ll learn how to use GitHub for collaboration, including pull requests, code reviews, and managing issues.
OAuth 2.0 is a popular authorization framework that enables applications to obtain limited access to user accounts. This course teaches you how to implement OAuth 2.0 in your APIs.
Cybersecurity is essential in today’s digital world. This course introduces key concepts in cybersecurity, including threat models, risk management, and security best practices.
Learn how to create and validate HTML forms in this comprehensive course. You'll explore form elements, client-side validation, and server-side processing techniques.
This course covers asynchronous programming in JavaScript using Promises and async/await. You’ll learn how to handle asynchronous operations and avoid callback hell.
Redux is a popular state management library for React. In this course, you'll learn how to manage application state effectively using Redux and its principles.
Learn how to implement authentication in your Node.js applications using techniques such as JWT, sessions, and OAuth.

Learn how to efficiently aggregate data in MongoDB using the aggregation pipeline. This course covers common aggregation operations like averages, counts, and using aggregation stages to transform data efficiently.

Slow queries can degrade the performance of your application. In this course, you’ll learn how to optimize your SQL and NoSQL queries to improve performance. Topics include indexing, query execution plans, and optimizing joins.

Designing for mobile devices first ensures that your websites are accessible to the widest range of users. This course teaches you the mobile-first design approach using CSS media queries and responsive techniques.

Branching is an important part of Git, allowing developers to work on different features or fixes simultaneously. In this course, you'll explore popular branching strategies such as Git Flow and GitHub Flow.

GraphQL is an alternative to REST that provides more flexibility in how clients request data from APIs. This course introduces the basics of GraphQL, including defining schemas, writing queries, and resolving data.
HTTPS is essential for securing data transmitted between your website and users. This course teaches you how to implement HTTPS using SSL/TLS certificates, ensuring that data is encrypted and secure.

Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) combine the best of web and mobile apps, providing a seamless experience across devices. This course will teach you how to create PWAs that are fast, reliable, and capable of working offline.
Error handling is a critical part of writing reliable JavaScript applications. In this course, you’ll learn about the different types of errors in JavaScript and how to handle them gracefully.
React Router is an essential library for managing navigation in React applications. This course will teach you how to set up routing, nested routes, and dynamic routing in your React apps.

Data validation is crucial for maintaining data integrity in your applications. In this course, you will learn how to validate incoming data in Node.js applications using popular libraries like Joi and express-validator.
MongoDB Atlas is a fully-managed cloud database service. This course provides an overview of how to set up, manage, and scale your MongoDB databases in the cloud using Atlas.

Data warehousing involves collecting and managing data from different sources. In this course, you will learn about data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and best practices for designing data warehouses.
Figma is a popular design tool for creating user interfaces. This course covers the basics of using Figma to design and prototype UI components and layouts.

Commit messages are vital for maintaining a readable and understandable project history. In this course, you’ll learn best practices for writing effective commit messages in Git. You’ll explore conventional commit formats, how to structure messages, and how well-written commits can improve collaboration and code reviews.

Caching is an important optimization technique for APIs, helping reduce server load and improve response times. In this course, you’ll learn how to implement caching strategies for APIs, including HTTP caching, Redis, and in-memory caching. These techniques will enable you to build more efficient APIs that scale better under high traffic.
